answerText: iron [or Fe][10] Heme groups are examples of this class of cofactors, which are tightly bound or covalently bonded to their proteins, unlike coenzymes.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2015 | UGA + Ohio State + Editors 1 | 7 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Enzymes such as aconitase contain clusters composed of sulfur and this element. For 10 points each: [10] Name this metal. An ion of this metal sits in the center of the porphyrin rings of heme groups.
